page.title: 12The use of modern appliances
page.content: We found that nearly everyone had a telephone and television. Most people had washing machines and a large minority had a tumble drier. Nearly everyone had a freezer because they shopped one a week. Without a freezer, people would either have to buy more from the mobile shops, or travel more often. As 87% of the adults work, tumble driers and washing machine would be essential. Only a small minority of people own computers, although more posess video recorders and microwave ovens. It would seem that the villagers use the wonders of modern science to improve the quality of their lives.
